org.opendaylight.controller.forwardingrulesmanager.internal

Class ForwardingRulesManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opendaylight.controller.forwardingrulesmanager.internal.ForwardingRulesManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICacheUpdateAware<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>, IConfigurationAwareCommon, IConfigurationContainerAware, IForwardingRulesManager, PortGroupChangeListener, IContainerListener, IContainerLocalListener, IFlowProgrammerListener, IPluginOutFlowProgrammerService, IObjectReader, IInventoryListener, ISwitchManagerAware

    public class ForwardingRulesManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IForwardingRulesManager, PortGroupChangeListener, IContainerLocalListener, ISwitchManagerAware, IConfigurationContainerAware, IInventoryListener, IObjectReader, ICacheUpdateAware<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>, IFlowProgrammerListener
    Class that manages forwarding rule installation and removal per container of the network. It also maintains the central repository of all the forwarding rules installed on the network nodes.

    • Method Detail

      • installFlowEntry

        public Status installFlowEntry(FlowEntry flowEntry)
        Description copied from interface: IForwardingRulesManager
        It requests FRM to install the passed Flow Entry. FRM will request the SDN protocol plugin to install the flow on the network node. Based on the result of this operation FRM will update its database accordingly and will return the proper Status code.
        Specified by:
        installFlowEntry in interface IForwardingRulesManager
        Parameters:
        flowEntry - the flow entry to install
        Returns:
        the Status object indicating the result of this action.

      • installFlowEntryAsync

        public Status installFlowEntryAsync(FlowEntry flowEntry)
        Description copied from interface: IForwardingRulesManager
        It requests FRM to install the passed Flow Entry through an asynchronous call. A unique request id is returned to the caller. FRM will request the SDN protocol plugin to install the flow on the network node. As immediate result of this asynchronous call, FRM will update its flow database as if the flow was successfully installed.
        Specified by:
        installFlowEntryAsync in interface IForwardingRulesManager
        Parameters:
        flowEntry - the flow entry to install
        Returns:
        the status of this request containing the request id associated to this asynchronous request

      • uninstallFlowEntry

        public Status uninstallFlowEntry(FlowEntry flowEntry)
        Description copied from interface: IForwardingRulesManager
        It requests FRM to remove the passed Flow Entry. FRM will request the SDN protocol plugin to uninstall the flow from the network node. Based on the result of this operation FRM will update its database accordingly and will return the proper Status code.
        Specified by:
        uninstallFlowEntry in interface IForwardingRulesManager
        Parameters:
        flowEntry - the flow entry to uninstall
        Returns:
        the Status object indicating the result of this action

      • modifyFlowEntry

        public Status modifyFlowEntry(FlowEntry currentFlowEntry,
                     FlowEntry newFlowEntry)
        Description copied from interface: IForwardingRulesManager
        It requests FRM to replace the currently installed Flow Entry with the new one. It is up to the SDN protocol plugin to decide how to convey this message to the network node. It could be a delete + add or a single modify message depending on the SDN protocol specifications If the current flow is equal to the new one it will be a no op and success code is returned.
        Specified by:
        modifyFlowEntry in interface IForwardingRulesManager
        Parameters:
        currentFlowEntry - the current flow entry to modify
        newFlowEntry - the new flow entry which will replace the current one
        Returns:
        the Status object indicating the result of this action

      • modifyFlowEntryAsync

        public Status modifyFlowEntryAsync(FlowEntry currentFlowEntry,
                          FlowEntry newFlowEntry)
        Description copied from interface: IForwardingRulesManager
        It requests FRM to replace the currently installed Flow Entry with the new one through an asynchronous call. A unique request id is returned to the caller. It is up to the SDN protocol plugin to decide how to convey this message to the network node. It could be a delete + add or a single modify message depending on the SDN protocol specifications. If the current flow is equal to the new one it will be a no op.
        Specified by:
        modifyFlowEntryAsync in interface IForwardingRulesManager
        Parameters:
        currentFlowEntry - the current flow entry to modify
        newFlowEntry - the new flow entry which will replace the current one
        Returns:
        the status of this request containing the request id associated to this asynchronous request

      • modifyOrAddFlowEntry

        public Status modifyOrAddFlowEntry(FlowEntry newFlowEntry)
        Description copied from interface: IForwardingRulesManager
        It requests the FRM to replace the currently installed Flow Entry with the new one. The currently installed entry is derived by the Match portion of the passed Flow. FRM looks in its database for a previously installed FlowEntry which Match equals the Match of the passed Flow. If it finds it, it will request the SDN protocol plugin to replace the existing flow with the new one on the network node. If it does not find it, it will request plugin to add the new flow. If the passed entry is not valid an error code is returned. If the existing flow is equal to the passed one it will be a no op and success code is returned.
        Specified by:
        modifyOrAddFlowEntry in interface IForwardingRulesManager
        Parameters:
        newFlowEntry - the new flow entry to install
        Returns:
        the Status object indicating the result of this action

      • modifyOrAddFlowEntryAsync

        public Status modifyOrAddFlowEntryAsync(FlowEntry newFlowEntry)
        Description copied from interface: IForwardingRulesManager
        It requests the FRM to replace the currently installed Flow Entry with the new one through an asynchronous call. A unique request id is returned to the caller. The currently installed entry is derived by the Match portion of the passed Flow. FRM looks in its database for a previously installed FlowEntry which Match equals the Match of the passed Flow. If it finds it, it will request the SDN protocol plugin to replace the existing flow with the new one on the network node. If it does not find it, it will request plugin to add the new flow. If the passed entry is not valid a zero request id is returned. If the existing flow is equal to the passed one it will be a no op.
        Specified by:
        modifyOrAddFlowEntryAsync in interface IForwardingRulesManager
        Parameters:
        newFlowEntry - the new flow entry to install
        Returns:
        the unique id associated to this request. In case of not acceptable request -1 will be returned.

      • uninstallFlowEntryGroup

        public Status uninstallFlowEntryGroup(java.lang.String groupName)
        Description copied from interface: IForwardingRulesManager
        It requests FRM to remove all the Flow Entry that are part of the specified group. FRM will request the SDN protocol plugin to uninstall the flows from the network node one by one. Based on the result of this operation FRM will update its database accordingly and will return the proper Status code.
        Specified by:
        uninstallFlowEntryGroup in interface IForwardingRulesManager
        Parameters:
        groupName - the group name
        Returns:
        the Status object indicating the result of this action

      • uninstallFlowEntryGroupAsync

        public Status uninstallFlowEntryGroupAsync(java.lang.String groupName)
        Description copied from interface: IForwardingRulesManager
        It requests FRM to remove all the Flow Entry that are part of the specified group through an asynchronous call. FRM will request the SDN protocol plugin to uninstall the flows from the network node one by one. As immediate result of this asynchronous call, FRM will update its flow database as if the flow was successfully removed.
        Specified by:
        uninstallFlowEntryGroupAsync in interface IForwardingRulesManager
        Parameters:
        groupName - the group name
        Returns:
        the Status object indicating the result of this action

        public java.util.List<FlowEntry> getFlowEntriesForGroup(java.lang.String policyName)
        Description copied from interface: IForwardingRulesManager
        Returns the list of Flow entries across network nodes which are part of the same flow group, policy. This list contains the flows as they were requested to be installed by the applications, before any merging with container flow is done.

      • getInstalledFlowEntriesForGroup

        public java.util.List<FlowEntry> getInstalledFlowEntriesForGroup(java.lang.String policyName)
        Description copied from interface: IForwardingRulesManager
        Returns the list of Flow entries installed in network nodes which are part of the same flow group, policy. This list contains the effective flows installed on the nodes after the merging with any possible container flow was performed. If no container flow are specified, this method returns the same list returned by getFlowEntriesForGroup(String group).
        Specified by:
        getInstalledFlowEntriesForGroup in interface IForwardingRulesManager
        Returns:
        the list of container flow merged flow entries belonging to the specified group

      • solicitStatusResponse

        public Status solicitStatusResponse(Node node,
                           boolean blocking)
        Description copied from interface: IForwardingRulesManager
        Requests ForwardingRulesManager to solicit the network node to inform us about the status of its execution on the asynchronous requests that were sent to it so far. It is a way for an application to poke the network node in order to get a feedback asap on the asynchronous requests generated by the application. The caller may decide if this is a blocking or non-blocking operation. If blocking is set to true, the caller will be blocked until the solicitation response is received from the network node or receive timeout. Otherwise, it is a non-blocking call and does not guarantee the node will respond in any given time.
        Specified by:
        solicitStatusResponse in interface IForwardingRulesManager
        Parameters:
        node - The network node to solicit a response
        blocking - The blocking mode
        Returns:
        the status of this request containing the request id associated to this asynchronous request

      • getInstalledFlowEntriesForNode

        public java.util.List<FlowEntry> getInstalledFlowEntriesForNode(Node node)
        Returns the list of Flow entries installed in a network node. This list contains the effective flows installed on the nodes after the merging with any possible container flow was performed. If no container flow are specified, this method returns the same list as returned by getFlowEntriesForNode(Node node).
        Specified by:
        getInstalledFlowEntriesForNode in interface IForwardingRulesManager
        Returns:
        the list of container flow merged flow entries belonging to the specified node
